intro: Veronica austriaca f. praeterita, commonly known as the Austrian speedwell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Plantaginaceae family. It is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. This subspecies is native to Central Europe and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces flowers from late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
